Yeah, this actually looks like a new look bug. Here are the steps to reproduce:
1. Open synchronize view with floating toolbar enabled
2. click the toolbar item to switch between synchronize partners
3. the list is shown correctly, nothing bad happens
4. click the pin button in the same flooting toolbar
5. click again on the item to switch between synchronize partners

NPE occurs. I think this is caused because the UI is calling dispose on the
action but still using the action in the new pinned toolbar. The assumption in
the action that NPE'd is that no other method will be called after dispose().
Moving the bug back to you guys...

I increase the severity as this bug makes the new look unusable in a workspace 
where I want to merge two different branches of my repository...
I have two syncronized partners registered:
 - CVS Workspace
 - CVS Merge: Root_JDK_1_5 to HEAD
The merge is really complex and have been done since several weeks. So, this 
view contains lot of synchronization information and cannot be replaced by a 
new without a long time of work.
But due to this bug I cannot retrieve these information :( and the only 
workaround I have is to come back to old look...

Fix released to HEAD. dispose now follows the spec for IMenuCreator by 
disposing the created menu, but will allow subsequent getMenu calls.
